result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey Allen Hammer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to 15CM276.
Defendant to report to Probation today January 22, 2016 by 11:00 a.m.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 15CM276

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file.
DNA surcharge.

-Domestic Abuse Evaluation if requested.
-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with Shirley H.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Nicholas Von Davis   DF:  Jeffrey Allen Hammer appeared. Includes 15CM276, 15CM382 and 15CM503. Case called at 8:35 am.ADA Correll makes recites agreement. No objection from Atty Davis.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count #1 in 15CM276 and Count #1 in 15CM382. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty on Count #1 in15CM276 and Count #1 in 15CM382. Court dismisses Count #2 in 15CM276 and all counts in 15CM503. Atty's Davis makes argument. ADA Correll makes statement.
Court orders:
15CM276 - 1 year probation w/h
- 90 Days Jail STAYED
- Court Costs
- Domestic Abuse Surcharge
- DNA Surcharge; Apply Bond
- AODA
- Domestic Abuse Evaluation if requested
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to possess a firearm
- No Abusive contact with S. Hammer.
- Sign up for probation by 1/22/2016 at 11:00 am
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees

On 15CM382: 1 yr probation - Concurrent to 15CM276
- 45 Days jail i/s
Court orders only one DNA Sample and Surcharge
 Probation review hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 04:30 pm.

INCLUDES 15CM382, 15CM276  & 15CM503

BOND ON FILE

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Defendant to provide a PBT test every Sunday by 5:00 p.m. at the St. Croix County Jail or any Police Department.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Shirley H.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
